recipes.title: Honey Balsamic Chicken over Rice {Allergy Friendly!}

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken can be paired with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 27 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Selected from three of California's most recognized Chardonnay appellations, Sonoma, Monterey and Napa, our Ghost Pines Chardonnay offers expressive, fruit-forward characteristics. The artful combination of these three regions delivers baked apple, pear and lemon cream flavors, accented by an elegant finish of sweet vanilla.

recipes.instructions: Marinate chicken breasts in Italian dressing for at least 4 hours or overnight.Sprinkle chicken with salt, pepper, and thyme.Grill appx 5-7 mins on each side until done.Make brown rice according to package directions. Set aside.Pour balsamic and honey into a small sauce pan, bring to a simmer on med-high heat and stir until it thickens {about 3-5 mins}.Place rice on dish, top with chicken, ladle on sauce, and garnish with chick peas, feta cheese and cranberries.

steps.step: Marinate chicken breasts in Italian dressing for at least 4 hours or overnight.Sprinkle chicken with salt, pepper, and thyme.Grill appx 5-7 mins on each side until done.Make brown rice according to package directions. Set aside.
Pour balsamic and honey into a small sauce pan, bring to a simmer on med-high heat and stir until it thickens {about 3-5 mins}.
Place rice on dish, top with chicken, ladle on sauce, and garnish with chick peas, feta cheese and cranberries.
